content:
ergehring said
What would cause an unexpected error when trying to export a profile?

Very often an antivirus product. It will also be slowing the export, often by a lot while is fiddles and muddles re-scanning everything that is accessed to copy it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thank you for your response. I have disabled the anti virus software. The export reaches about 45% before encountering the error.
creator: ergehring

content:
Duane Doberman said
Can anyone suggest how we stop the auto-creation of these subfolders? Many thanks in anticipation!

The files are created when the file is unavailable due to file contention, Thunderbird just goes off and creates a new file and gives it a number in that circumstance. Folk that more the location data is stored from the default %appdata% folder are those most likely to have issues as they tend to place exceedingly large file into the general documents storage so their antivirus spends half it's time rescanning the same 4 or 5gb file each time a single email is added to it or marked read.

Most likely cause is your antivirus scanning the folder the emails are stored in prevent that and see how you go.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Se sei certo di aver configurato Thunderbird con i giusti parametri, allora devi contattare il fornitore/gestore della casella email. È un errore lato server, non dipende da Thunderbird.

content:
Se leggi l'articolo che ti ho indicato vedrai che le possibili cause sono sostanzialmente due: - estensioni incompatibili/difettose - incompatibilità con l'accelerazione hardware

Per il primo caso si procede disattivando tutte le estensioni e riattivandone una per volta fino ad individuare quella problematica.

Per la seconda, verifica se esistono driver più aggiornati per la tua scheda grafica. Se poi non risolvi puoi disattivare completamente l'accelerazione hardware: Menu > Impostazioni > Generali e togli la spunta da Utilizza l’accelerazione hardware quando disponibile

Se il problema non fosse ancora risolto, puoi comunque sempre utilizzare la Modalità risoluzione dei problemi in attesa magari di qualche prossimo aggiornamento.
creator: @next

content: First, I suggest you verify that you can read email from your online account. That would ensure that you have a working password.
creator: davidsk

content:
What is most likely happening is that the email address @alice.dsl.net belongs to the old email service, which was actually taken over by Telefonica Germany.

Now, many email accounts have been shut down, which restricts or requires re-authentication. And there may be many reasons, like: The mailbox is not actively used through O2 systems, or the account is linked to an old DSL contract. There may be some security updates also.

Basically, it means thatthe password you are entering can be correct, but the mail server has been refusing or has been deactivated.

You should immediately log in to O2 webmail, and if it fail,s the problem is in the account and not the mail program. Secondly, contact the O2 support as they can help you better, and your query will be solved faster.
creator: rooclown101

content:
It may look like a duplicate account (but is not) because you seem to have re-named the local folders account, which cannot be deleted.

So do you have a server account and a local folders account with the same name?

In your place, I would change the name back to "Local folders".
creator: mozilla98

content: Suggestion: If you have two accounts in thunderbird with same domain, my guess is you have accidentally set both accounts to use the same SMTP server. For the one that is not working, try this; - click to 'account settings' for that account and highlight account name in left side bar - now, in lower right, click the 'edit SMTP server' button. note the email address for the SMTP server. does it match the email address for the account? If not, click back and click the drop-down menu and select the other SMTP server. -
creator: davidsk

creator: davidsk

content: David: I understand that. I'll break it down for you. I block the sender. I give the instruction to delete the message. It does the delete, but then sends it to Trash. I want to be able to do a hard delete, thereby bypassing the Trash bin.
creator: Coffee_Lover

content:
Coffee_Lover, how are you blocking the sender? How are you giving an instruction to delete? That may be where the confusion lies. Are you filtering the messages from a particular sender and sending them straight to the trash in the instructions in the filter? If that is what you are doing, just have the filter delete the messages instead of moving them to the trash.

(By the way, you are not actually blocking. Blocking can be done only at the server, not within Thunderbird. It would accomplish what you want. You may have some options at the server for doing this.)
creator: mozilla98

content: Your post is vague. Are you saying that pressing shift and delete does not work? Please be specific. On my Thunderbird, pressing shift and delete together permanently removes the message. If that is what you mean, I suggest restarting in troubleshoot mode and then see if it works.
creator: davidsk

content: No, that's not what I'm say. What I'm saying is that when I block a sender and tell the block to delete the message it deletes it by sending it to Trash, and not doing a hard delete. Then I have to go back and empty the Trash. I want to instruct the block to do a hard delete.
creator: Coffee_Lover

content: But what is "the block"? How are you trying to block messages from this sender?
creator: mozilla98

content: Blocking the sender following Thunderbird instructions.
creator: Coffee_Lover

content:
My third and final attempt.

We cannot help if you do not tell us what you are doing. As I said, there is no way to block senders in Thunderbird. Thunderbird can only filter messages. Which instructions are you using? Are you using a filter? Or doing something else? What? Are you using an add-on?
creator: mozilla98

content:
I found the instructions that you must be using: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/blocking-sender

I thought that the filter action "Delete" would do what you want, as opposed to an action to move the message to trash. I was wrong. I do not know if a filter can be made to "permanently" delete a message.

I block senders at the server. Maybe you can too. Doing it there is better if you use more than one way to access your mail.
